title: Rebuild CodeCrafter website for Internet Computer platform

requirements.text: Migrate the backend from Express/Node.js to Motoko architecture, preserving all existing authentication logic, user profile management, role-based access control (admin/user), and inquiry submission endpoints
acceptanceCriteria: Backend uses Motoko single-actor architecture in backend/main.mo
Admin authentication validates username 'admin' and password 'admin123'
User profile CRUD operations are implemented
Role-based access control distinguishes admin and user roles
Public inquiry submission endpoint accepts all form fields: Full Name, Email, Phone, Company Name, Website Type, Features/Requirements, Budget, Deadline, Additional Notes
All backend functionality from the Express implementation is preserved

requirements.text: Ensure frontend React application remains fully compatible with the new Motoko backend, updating actor integration and API calls as needed while preserving all existing UI components and functionality
acceptanceCriteria: useActor hook correctly interfaces with the Motoko backend actor
useQueries hooks work seamlessly with Motoko backend methods
Admin login, admin dashboard, and public homepage remain functional
Contact form submission successfully sends inquiries to Motoko backend
Internet Identity authentication integration works correctly
All existing UI components (HeroSection, ServicesSection, PortfolioSection, AboutSection, ContactSection, Layout) render without errors

requirements.text: Preserve all existing CodeCrafter branding elements, coral and charcoal color scheme, typography, responsive layouts, and visual design system across the rebuilt application
acceptanceCriteria: Site title remains 'CodeCrafter' in index.html
Logo text displays 'CodeCrafter' in Layout header
Hero section references 'CodeCrafter' as the agency name
About section includes CodeCrafter company story
Footer copyright displays 'Â© 2024 CodeCrafter. All rights reserved.'
Coral and charcoal color system using OKLCH is maintained
Tailwind CSS configuration and custom color variables remain intact
All animations, transitions, and hover effects are preserved

requirements.text: Configure the project for Internet Computer deployment with proper canister configuration, ensuring the application can be deployed and accessible via ic0.app domain
acceptanceCriteria: Project includes valid dfx.json configuration for Internet Computer deployment
Backend canister is properly configured with Motoko type
Frontend canister is configured to serve the React application
Application successfully deploys to Internet Computer
Deployed application is accessible via https://[canister-id].ic0.app URL
All routes (home, /login, /admin/dashboard) work in deployed environment

constraints: Must use Motoko for backend implementation (no Express/Node.js)
Must maintain single-actor architecture for all backend logic
Frontend paths in frontend.immutablePaths are read-only and must not be edited
Must preserve all existing feature implementations and UI components
Must maintain compatibility with Internet Identity authentication system
nonGoals: Adding new features beyond rebuilding for Internet Computer platform
Changing the visual design or branding beyond what currently exists
Modifying the contact form fields or inquiry submission logic
Adding additional authentication methods beyond Internet Identity
Implementing real-time features or WebSocket connections
